meanings.definition: The state of being subject to death.
meanings.sent1: The mortalitie of all living things is a natural part of life.
meanings.sent2: The doctor studied the mortalitie rates in different regions to understand health trends.
meanings.sent3: The cat joked about its nine lives, saying its mortalitie was just a myth.
meanings.sent4: In the game of chess, the king's mortalitie is the key to victory.
meanings.sent5: The ancient story of the phoenix rising from its own mortalitie symbolizes rebirth and renewal.

meanings.definition: The number of deaths in a given population or period.
meanings.sent1: The government tracks the mortalitie of various diseases to improve public health policies.
meanings.sent2: During the war, the mortalitie of soldiers was a tragic reality.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that his mortalitie on stage was when the audience stopped laughing.
meanings.sent4: The mortalitie of the old building was evident in its crumbling walls.
meanings.sent5: The mortalitie of the flowers in winter reminded her of the cycle of life and death.
